Realizar diversas tareas asociadas con la producci√≥n comercial y la cosecha de cultivos de hortalizas y fresas / frutas y flores cortadas. PREPARACI√ìN, DESHIERBE, INSTALACI√ìN DE PRODUCTOS Y OTRAS TAREAS RELACIONADAS CON UNA OPERACI√ìN DE VIVERO. About the Job:
Quality Assurance Technician (Bilingual)
At Prime Meats, we are obsessed with building long-term relationships with our customers. Every team member should feel empowered to deliver a world-class and unique experience based on what each customer needs. We are looking for a Quality Assurance Technician to help our Q&A team continue to ensure product quality standards!

We Offer:
‚Ä¢ Competitive pay.
‚Ä¢ Opportunities for growth and development within the company.
‚Ä¢ Medical/Dental/Vision health benefits.
‚Ä¢ 10 days of paid time off a year.
‚Ä¢ Referral Bonus Up to $200.
‚Ä¢ Paid Training.
‚Ä¢ Employee pricing on Prime Meats products.
‚Ä¢ Discounts on corporate purchases: a 50% discount for dine-in at all our restaurants: Frontera Mex-Mex Grill, Luciano‚Äôs, Pampas Steakhouse, and Frankie‚Äôs The Steakhouse.

POSITION SUMMARY:
‚Ä¢ Guarantee product satisfaction by coordinating, testing, and providing tools for quality assurance and compliance.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
‚Ä¢ Conduct quality audits on the production floor daily, including GMPS and housekeeping Inspection and follow-up of returns (complaints): review of product quality, packaging condition, product life, packaging, packaging, and presentation.
‚Ä¢ Conducting root-cause studies and implementing resulting corrective actions.
‚Ä¢ Control and follow-up of inspection records, compliance with standards, and records of suppliers, raw materials, distributors, and suppliers.
‚Ä¢ Preparation and management of technical data sheets for outgoing product from the process.
‚Ä¢ Fills out and reviews necessary paperwork for product audits and HACCP/SQF documents; Utilizing continuous improvement mindset, assists in identifying opportunities to improve processes.
‚Ä¢ Conduct raw and packaging component sampling, inspections.
‚Ä¢ Records and evaluates test data, alerting the QA manager to any deviations from specs. Perform pre-op inspections of sanitation standard operating procedures (SOPs); monitor room temperatures.
‚Ä¢ Address and discuss problems/proposes solutions with superiors; provides support to the QA Manager.
‚Ä¢ Follow and apply food safety, food defense, and policies. Any deviations must be communicated to the plant supervisor and the QA manager.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
‚Ä¢ 1 - 2 years of experience in a food-related manufacturing facility.
‚Ä¢ Quality Control experience in a food manufacturing facility.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of USDA/SQF/SOP/performance of inspections (is a plus).
‚Ä¢ Knowledge in basic GMPs (is a plus).
‚Ä¢ Must be able to read and write in English to perform necessary documentation.

PREFERRED EDUCATION:
‚Ä¢ College degree in Food Science or related field with HACCP certification.

About Prime Meats:

Prime Meats is a family-owned private meat packaging and distribution company based in Duluth, GA. Prime Meats has been serving restaurants, butcher shops, and grocery stores in the Southeast since 1992.

About the Job:
Quality Assurance Technician (Bilingual)
At Prime Meats, we are obsessed with building long-term relationships with our customers. Every team member should feel empowered to deliver a world-class and unique experience based on what each customer needs. We are looking for a Quality Assurance Technician to help our Q&A team continue to ensure product quality standards!

We Offer:
‚Ä¢ Competitive pay.
‚Ä¢ Opportunities for growth and development within the company.
‚Ä¢ Medical/Dental/Vision health benefits.
‚Ä¢ 10 days of paid time off a year.
‚Ä¢ Referral Bonus Up to $200.
‚Ä¢ Paid Training.
‚Ä¢ Employee pricing on Prime Meats products.
‚Ä¢ Discounts on corporate purchases: a 50% discount for dine-in at all our restaurants: Frontera Mex-Mex Grill, Luciano's, Pampas Steakhouse, and Frankie's The Steakhouse.

POSITION SUMMARY:
‚Ä¢ Guarantee product satisfaction by coordinating, testing, and providing tools for quality assurance and compliance.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
‚Ä¢ Conduct quality audits on the production floor daily, including GMPS and housekeeping Inspection and follow-up of returns (complaints): review of product quality, packaging condition, product life, packaging, packaging, and presentation.
‚Ä¢ Conducting root-cause studies and implementing resulting corrective actions.
‚Ä¢ Control and follow-up of inspection records, compliance with standards, and records of suppliers, raw materials, distributors, and suppliers.
‚Ä¢ Preparation and management of technical data sheets for outgoing product from the process.
‚Ä¢ Fills out and reviews necessary paperwork for product audits and HACCP/SQF documents; Utilizing continuous improvement mindset, assists in identifying opportunities to improve processes.
‚Ä¢ Conduct raw and packaging component sampling, inspections.
‚Ä¢ Records and evaluates test data, alerting the QA manager to any deviations from specs. Perform pre-op inspections of sanitation standard operating procedures (SOPs); monitor room temperatures.
‚Ä¢ Address and discuss problems/proposes solutions with superiors; provides support to the QA Manager.
‚Ä¢ Follow and apply food safety, food defense, and policies. Any deviations must be communicated to the plant supervisor and the QA manager.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
‚Ä¢ 1 - 2 years of experience in a food-related manufacturing facility.
‚Ä¢ Quality Control experience in a food manufacturing facility.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of USDA/SQF/SOP/performance of inspections (is a plus).
‚Ä¢ Knowledge in basic GMPs (is a plus).
‚Ä¢ Must be able to read and write in English to perform necessary documentation.

PREFERRED EDUCATION:
‚Ä¢ College degree in Food Science or related field with HACCP certification.

About Prime Meats:
Prime Meats is a family-owned private meat packaging and distribution company based in Duluth, GA. Prime Meats has been serving restaurants, butcher shops, and grocery stores in the Southeast since 1992.
